verdict.summary: Docker operation timed out. Common during image pulls from slow registries, large build contexts, or when the Docker daemon is overloaded.

dead_ends.action: Repeatedly retrying the same pull without addressing network conditions
dead_ends.why_fails: If the registry is throttling or the network is congested, retries without backoff make it worse

dead_ends.action: Increasing Docker daemon timeout to very large values
dead_ends.why_fails: Masks underlying network or registry issues; operations that genuinely fail will hang for excessive periods

workarounds.action: Check network connectivity and DNS resolution to the registry
workarounds.how: curl -v https://registry-1.docker.io/v2/ to test registry connectivity; check firewall rules and proxy settings

workarounds.action: Use a registry mirror or pull from a closer region
workarounds.condition: when pulling from Docker Hub with high latency

leads_to.condition: when the timeout is caused by DNS failures

preceded_by.condition: when daemon connectivity issues cause timeouts

frequently_confused_with.distinction: context deadline exceeded means the operation timed out, while context canceled means the operation was explicitly cancelled by the user or another process
